body: Is it OT pluginï¼Ÿ

I am sorry to say, it isn't. This is just about sky-walking tracer implementation. As our team has no time on trace visualization in batch mode, we have to delay it. 

In OT spec, we already have tags about message bus. And OT supported frameworks are here: https://github.com/opentracing-contrib/meta. Happy to have RocketMQ.

As 3.0 comes, this new UI is back. Here are the color resources.

![chart_](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5441976/24443054/a4d1d46a-1493-11e7-9a1f-cef68989fe77.png)
![chart-](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5441976/24443056/a66c75dc-1493-11e7-8eb2-fef4a80d2aba.png)
The UI has moved to sky-walking-ui. The issue stays because it existed long time ago.

Set the elasticsearch cluster config in collector.config file.
es.cluster.name
es.cluster.nodes
es.cluster.transport.sniffer

Set the elasticsearch index config in collector.config file.
es.index.shards.number
es.index.replicas.number

Set the elasticsearch cluster node config in collector.config file.

- cluster model: 
es.cluster.nodes=127.0.0.1:9300,127.0.0.2:9300,127.0.0.3:9300
- standalone
model: es.cluster.nodes=127.0.0.1:9300

Set the http restful service config in collector.config file.
- http.hostname=127.0.0.1
- http.port=7001
- http.contextPath=/
see mater
Related to #123

The process of test case as following: portal service receive key from http request, and it call the cache query service and query the key on the mysql service. finally update the cache by the new key. BTW, there are two layer on cache service. one is Redis, and the other is embed h2 database. The call graph as following: **Portal Server**: Entry of test case. Portal Server run in tomcat container. **Cache Server**: Cache service provide query and update cache. and it run in motan. **Persistence Server**: Persistence service provide query data from mysql, and it initial data when persistence service start. it run in Dubbo with rest protocol. Here are the configuration file of each application: - Portal Server: Portal server pass the config parameteres through system properties. ``` -javaagent:/skywalking-test/agent/skywalking-agent.jar -DapplicationCode=portal-service -Dservers=127.0.0.1:7001,127.0.0.1:17001,127.0.0.1:27001 ``` - Cache Server: Cache server pass the config parameteres through `sky-walking.config` file ``` -javaagent:/skywalking-test/agent/skywalking-agent.jar -DconfigPath=/path/of/sky-walking.config ``` Here is the context of sky-walking.config ```properties agent.application_code=cache-service collector.servers=127.0.0.1:7001,127.0.0.1:17001,127.0.0.1:27001 ``` - Persistence Server: Same as Portal server. ``` -javaagent:/skywalking-test/agent/skywalking-agent.jar -DapplicationCode=persistence-service -Dservers=127.0.0.1:7001,127.0.0.1:17001,127.0.0.1:27001 ``` - Skywalking collector: Here are the `collector.config` of three collector instances. Instance One: ``` cluster.current.hostname=127.0.0.1 cluster.current.port=7000 cluster.seed_nodes=127.0.0.1:7000,127.0.0.1:17000,,127.0.0.1:27000 http.hostname=127.0.0.1 http.port=7001 ``` Instance Two: ``` cluster.current.hostname=127.0.0.1 cluster.current.port=17000 cluster.seed_nodes=127.0.0.1:7000,127.0.0.1:17000,,127.0.0.1:27000 http.hostname=127.0.0.1 http.port=17001 ``` Instance Three: ``` cluster.current.hostname=127.0.0.1 cluster.current.port=27000 cluster.seed_nodes=127.0.0.1:7000,127.0.0.1:17000,,127.0.0.1:27000 http.hostname=127.0.0.1 http.port=27001 ``` **topological graph**

thank you

We double check the docker-compose. Your log is true, but it is harmless. Because when 2.x, we did not check the Elasticsearch status, just try to connect. Sorry.

We have improved in 3.0. By the whole new architecture, this should never happen again.
Is that error log not affecting the skywalking system? Even though i have installed agent in my web application, nothing appears on web ui.(http://localhost:8080/skywalking/mainPage)

Yes, it did not affect. Here is my double check result.

![97e17f9466d4b16d775b49523a916900](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5441976/24950432/9a2acb96-1fa3-11e7-8312-c402246e66c3.jpg)

As you got nothing on the UI, you need understand these things first.
- The UI show the trace only when you have a trace id.
- The two ways you got the trace id in 2.x are,
  1. Error alarm mails. Exceptions or slow transactions occur in your application.
  1. Use the application-log-toolkit, then the traceid is in your application log. Like [log4j2-toolkit](https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/wiki/sky-walking-application-toolkit-log4j-2.x)

I think these two ways are both not easy enough, so we give you the new feature about query traces without any conditions in 3.0. : ) Hope everyone love this feature.
It would be better to wait for 3.0. Thank you for your reply.
Delete branch collector, and 3.0 is almost ready to release.
It is a bug of UI.

@bai-yang I think you should set a config for `MongoDBMethodInterceptor.getReadOperationInfo`. By default, you only trace the operationName, without data or keys. Only the flag is true, you trace liek this.

- In spring-cloud ecosystem, by default, the server-side use embed Tomcat (uncertain the version, yet), so maybe we already supported.

- In client side, here is some answers from Adrian Cole, Spring
https://docs.spring.io/spring/docs/current/javadoc-api/org/springframework/http/client/support/HttpAccessor.html#setRequestFactory-org.springframework.http.client.ClientHttpRequestFactory-
so default for resttemplate (the normal rest library) is standard library (HttpUrlConnection), but it can use others like okhttp.
